body.p: Printing is supported in Text, Author, and Grid modes. The Print())) action that is available from File menu displays the Page Setup dialog box, used for defining the page size and orientation properties for printing.
A Print Preview action is also available in the File menu. It allows you to manage the format of the printed document.
body.note: If you are printing in the Author visual editing mode to change the styling of the document in the printed output, you can use the CSS print media type.
body.p: The main window is split in three sections:

ul.li: Preview area - Displays the formatted document page as it will appear on printed paper.
Left stripe - The left-side stripe that displays a list of thumbnail pages. Clicking any of them displays the page content in the main preview area.
Toolbar - The toolbar area at the top that contains controls for printing, page settings, page navigation, print scaling, and zoom.

body.note: If your document is open in Author mode and contains Track Changes, you can print (or print preview) a copy of the document as if all changes have been accepted by switching the Track Changes Visualization Modes to View Final.
